content:
Yes, just like any other species, cuckoo chicks have natural predators and enemies. Some predators of cuckoo chicks include birds of prey such as hawks, owls and eagles, and ground predators such as foxes and cats. In addition, when cuckoo chicks are outside of their host bird's nest, they are vulnerable to predation by other birds, such as magpies or jays.

However, cuckoo chicks have evolved some strategies to mitigate the risk of predation. For example, some cuckoo chicks will remain very still and remain silent when approached by predators or enemies, which can help them avoid detection. In addition, cuckoo chicks are often raised alongside host bird chicks, which can help provide some protection from predators due to the increased number of birds in the nest.
